body_html:
That blog post is out of date. Installing pytorch from source with CUDA 9.0 and cuDNN 7.0 should just work. NCCL workaround is no longer necessary.

To get NCCL2 you can follow the dockerfile
https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/tools/docker/Dockerfile9

abridged version:
echo "deb http://developer.download.nvidia.com/compute/machine-learning/repos/ubuntu1604/x86_64 /" > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/nvidia-ml.list
sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install -y libnccl2=2.0.5-3+cuda9.0 libnccl-dev=2.0.5-3+cuda9.0

If you run into any problems please provide the details so we can help to debug.
